20-019EC.summary: Recommendation to approve the minutes of the Ethics Commission Special Meeting of Wednesday, July 15, 2020.Page 1 of 9TELECONFERENCE, 3:00 PMWEDNESDAY, AUGUST 12, 2020CITY OF LONG BEACHETHICS COMMISSION MINUTESChair Wise spoke.Amy Webber, Deputy City Attorney, spoke.A motion was made by Vice Chair Morales, seconded by Commissioner Pollack, to approve recommendation.  The motion carried by the following vote:Yes: 7 - Lani De Benedictis, Luke Fiedler, Kimmy Maniquis, Barbara Pollack, J. P. Shotwell, Margo Morales and Susan Wise2.

20-020EC.summary: Recommendation to adopt resolution stating the rules and procedures for the Ethics Commission.Amy Webber, Deputy City Attorney, spoke; and presented the staff report.Commissioner Pollack spoke.A dialogue ensued between Commissioner Pollack and Amy Webber, Deputy City Attorney.Commissioner Shotwell spoke.Amy Webber, Deputy City Attorney, spoke.Vice Chair Morales spoke.Amy Webber, Deputy City Attorney, spoke.A dialogue ensued between Vice Chair Morales and Amy Webber, Deputy City Attorney.Commissioner Pollack spoke.Commissioner Shotwell spoke.Amy Webber, Deputy City Attorney, spoke.Vice Chair Morales spoke.Chair Wise spoke.Page 2 of 9TELECONFERENCE, 3:00 PMWEDNESDAY, AUGUST 12, 2020CITY OF LONG BEACHETHICS COMMISSION MINUTESAmy Webber, Deputy City Attorney, spoke.Rebecca Garner, Administrative Deputy City Manager, spoke.Vice Chair Morales spoke.Commissioner Pollack spoke.Amy Webber, Deputy City Attorney, spoke.Chair Wise spoke.Vice Chair Morales spoke.Commissioner Pollack spoke.Chair Wise spoke.A dialogue ensued between Chair Wise and Commissioner Pollack.Commissioner De Benedictis spoke.Chair Wise spoke.Amy Webber, Deputy City Attorney, spoke.Commissioner Shotwell spoke.Commissioner Maniquis spoke.Amy Webber, Deputy City Attorney, spoke.Vice Chair Morales spoke.Rebecca Garner, Administrative Deputy City Manager, spoke.A motion was made by Commissioner Fiedler, seconded by Commissioner Pollack, to approve recommendation as amended, to include revisions to the resolution language; and adopt Resolution E.C. 01-2020.  The motion carried by the following vote:Page 3 of 9TELECONFERENCE, 3:00 PMWEDNESDAY, AUGUST 12, 2020CITY OF LONG BEACHETHICS COMMISSION MINUTESYes: 7 - Lani De Benedictis, Luke Fiedler, Kimmy Maniquis, Barbara Pollack, J. P. Shotwell, Margo Morales and Susan WiseEnactment No: E.C. 01-20203.

20-021EC.summary: Recommendation to receive and file an update on the Proposed FY21 Budget.Rebecca Garner, Administrative Deputy City Manager, spoke; and presented the staff report.Chair Wise spoke.Rebecca Garner, Administrative Deputy City Manager, spoke.A dialogue between Chair Wise and Rebecca Garner, Administrative Deputy City Manager.A motion was made by Commissioner Pollack, seconded by Commissioner Shotwell, to approve recommendation.  The motion carried by the following vote:Yes: 7 - Lani De Benedictis, Luke Fiedler, Kimmy Maniquis, Barbara Pollack, J. P. Shotwell, Margo Morales and Susan Wise4.

20-022EC.summary: Recommendation to conduct a study session regarding the selection process for the Long Beach Independent Redistricting Commission.Jonathan Nagayama, City Clerk Analyst spoke; and provided a PowerPoint presentation.Commissioner Fiedler spoke.Jonathan Nagayama, City Clerk Analyst, spoke.A dialogue between Commissioner Fielder and Jonathan Nagayama, City Clerk Analyst.Vice Chair Morales spoke.Jonathan Nagayama, City Clerk Analyst, spoke.Page 4 of 9TELECONFERENCE, 3:00 PMWEDNESDAY, AUGUST 12, 2020CITY OF LONG BEACHETHICS COMMISSION MINUTESRebecca Garner, Administrative Deputy City Manager, spoke.Chair Wise spoke.Jonathan Nagayama, City Clerk Analyst, spoke.A dialogue ensued between Chair Wise and Jonathan Nagayama, City Clerk Analyst, spoke.Amy Webber, Deputy City Attorney, spoke.Chair Wise spoke.A dialogue ensued between Chair Wise and Amy Webber, Deputy City Attorney.Jonathan Nagayama, City Clerk Analyst, spoke.Chair Wise spoke.A dialogue ensued between Chair Wise and Jonathan Nagayama, City Clerk Analyst.Commissioner Pollack spoke.Chair Wise spoke.Commissioner Shotwell spoke.Vice Chair Morales spoke.Jonathan Nagayama, City Clerk Analyst, spoke.Commissioner Shotwell spoke.Jonathan Nagayama, City Clerk Analyst, spoke.A dialogue ensued between Commissioner Shotwell and Jonathan Nagayama, City Clerk Analyst.Commissioner Maniquis spoke.Page 5 of 9TELECONFERENCE, 3:00 PMWEDNESDAY, AUGUST 12, 2020CITY OF LONG BEACHETHICS COMMISSION MINUTESVice Chair Morales spoke.Jonathan Nagayama, City Clerk Analyst, spoke.Commissioner De Benedictis spoke.Chair Wise spoke.Jonathan Nagayama, City Clerk Analyst, spoke.A dialogue ensued between Chair Wise and Jonathan Nagayama,City Clerk Analyst.This EC-Agenda Item was received and filed.5.

20-023EC.summary: Recommendation to approve the selection process for the Long Beach Independent Redistricting Commission and any other actions necessary to carry out the plan.Chair Wise spoke.Amy Webber, Deputy City Attorney, spoke.Commissioner De Benedictis spoke.Vice Chair Morales spoke.Jonathan Nagayama, City Clerk Analyst, spoke.Commissioner Pollack spoke.Chair Wise spoke.Page 6 of 9TELECONFERENCE, 3:00 PMWEDNESDAY, AUGUST 12, 2020CITY OF LONG BEACHETHICS COMMISSION MINUTESA motion was made by Chair Wise, seconded by Commissioner Maniquis, as amended,as amended, to adopt staff recommendations; establish three ad hoc committees, Committee A will include Commissioner Shotwell, Commissioner Fiedler, and Commissioner Maniquis, Committee B will include Vice Chair Morales and Commissioner De Benedictis, and Committee C will include Chair Wise and Commissioner Pollack; assign Commissioners to review applicants from Council districts other than the one in which the Commissioners reside; and discuss the selections by each ad hoc committee at a publicly noticed meeting.  The motion carried by the following vote:Yes: 7 - Lani De Benedictis, Luke Fiedler, Kimmy Maniquis, Barbara Pollack, J. P. Shotwell, Margo Morales and Susan Wise6.
